title: Grade 6
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

AF33229583AB4F9AAC858D4AC297CA5F.description: Use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases across contexts.

4BDAB569AFD54DE3972335A195678521.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

7CB2D58DE22F420DBDE55A3C7A62169D.description: Demonstrate understanding of words by identifying other words with similar and different meanings.

8682A7D051114652A694E0A508323925.description: Determine the meaning of simple similes (e.g., The man was big as a tree.).

CC22BCCDA93342FB837C541BF6CACD30.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use.

01A9697854604A9E99126436A59539E6.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

00C5322ADE6449459E346B384462F3DC.description: Demonstrate knowledge of word meanings drawn from grade 6 content using context clues.

D102000E1BB9464A83D175B0D59FEEF7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

5A454921E0AA4FB5A2E3F4B7273B45B6.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes by attempting to repair communication when a reader or listener does not understand the initial
attempt.

15A1DE5711B840C89C4FCCE346D9AA15.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

A4F44CCA344D4F43AC2A2723EDCF117D.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English within 6-8 conventions continuum when writing.

7BB3E59290794427AC2F631DE86B92D1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

113346B50E3C4F0080E936B2F045B689.description: Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage within the 6-8 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

045AE113997A4FB1A89466A17E78275F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

675168D4D1714C4CB6D6D8B0512FB364.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

AA484EE71B9049498A35C8488AFE8549.description: Select an auditory, visual, or tactual display to clarify the information in presentations.

BE24B9C1E5984634A5FF36697CA03552.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

AA8EF031437646E3BBBDD1F3E9F9B95F.description: Communicate findings including descriptions, facts, or details related to main idea or theme.

7472FEB1AED244559E06624573AC470C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

6AE9DC39A0B3488AA91368B137A72DA3.description: Identify the points the speaker makes by reasons and evidence supporting the claims made by the speaker.

B69E9DDA89324A67BAE9C1F60FB80035.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

F186DA5E3A8D48E48D0C925837052E79.description: Identify information presented in diverse media and formats that relates to a topic, text, or issue under study.

4D6A3A7140C3403DA9D9C77ED0A7839F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

68DF25CADD104B909C0CBAACD4C89D15.description: Restate key ideas expressed in the discussion.

48976213B94945A49F0C8BD2AFA19D6E.description: Ask and answer questions specific to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

6349D2BA1CF94FBE9443B86EA0C4F082.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, follow simple, agreed-upon rules for discussions and contribute information.

3F4F438F6A5B4AE890BA678C4400B8D4.description: Come to discussions prepared to share information.

1E1AEF89F7EF46079DEEBB3815C16D1C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

D092FC6EC99F4A8FB120B0513C4791F7.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

6BD0756A9B49419F9746270D45135DD1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

9C94AC2A57A141988D100E4F1A8F9A02.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

96ABA5F2F23C4C6BA20CA9144747AF07.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

2AB8D9F8F51B4CC9AE70DCEB9C18547C.description: Gather information from multiple print and digital sources that relates to a given topic.

799CD7B93133494A889D45189CCD7D3E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

7B01A31FD2094761A5C8EAED5F415A43.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question.

8B9A69FDDC0640F5BD2759FC58AE45E9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

41CA08B6810A40379CB54E2ABDEB9499.description: Use digital tools create to produce and publish writing while interacting and collaborating with others.

B34B80F104B541C885807CC7793C2E5A.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

D1B064FE189C412B896EA5CF0E367E16.description: Use words that convey specific details about the experience or event.

7933345698344CAAB9ABDA585BC3DFE0.description: Use words that establish the time frame.

C63B802D0080420AB33AEBA5FE75C14B.description: Write a narrative about a real or imagined experience introducing the experience and including two or more events.

9BE502C7565C4527A24E96AE2F32B452.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

1A68BFABA6DF49D0A60BF9F8B208393B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

7A4079ADF28A4F5391F60499CBBA5A96.description: Provide facts, details, or other information related to the topic.

1896CC13AF404E798F5AA36D570F1633.description: Introduce a topic and write to convey ideas and information about it including visual, tactual, or multimedia information as appropriate.

CE9FB437627C4CC58AF34132CE929A96.description: Write to share information supported by details.

958C2A7C2B1E4AF4A51F2D7CA30E0DE3.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

89FB90CF880847278ACAE88C723D9077.description: Write one or more reasons to support a claim about a topic or text

EAA77C09F1CB49B3AD9522B414865844.description: Write a claim about a topic or text.

C66C4684595C417AB04AB1B9318795EC.description: Write claims about topics or text.

47656262CD1E4707B2503DDCF16EB5D4.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

C7F81FC78BD748AB857D33B5B2A304AB.description:
Actively engage in reading of information text for sustained periods of time for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to
text.

930C5C84141D489194589786F162CB07.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

9738BAF924744E699B4F2F397797F8F7.description: Compare how two texts describe the same event.

076FAF42DACB47E18A70EA801895C66A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

51B5E2CAD33141AB85CD56A21D849250.description: Determine claims in a text that are and are not supported by reasons or evidence.

BD17137F1CCB49F298DFD4799D73F19E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

F9BFD6076F53418FB0C52AB77D493FAD.description: Find similarities across information presented in different formats.

CD9B3A6AC0724534A189B939B2026DEC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

3066617B155744658DF76A0208DCA3A8.description: Determine an author’s purpose or point of view.

CE75FBB52F544543849D763ED029530B.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

B7CD1A3E6C394C7F8E0660DF7C4A08D3.description: Determine how the title fits the structure of the text.

C347FD029D294A338D40283AE29243DD.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

16F57609AEDB4283A14871B5CF3ED58C.description: Determine how word choice changes the meaning of a text.

95E8AAA53BE645FC95DEF14D67BA32DF.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

892A54CFCE5949E5B541B5C64B71094D.description: Identify information in the text that provides details about individuals, events, or ideas introduced in the text

191F2D2B262E4CD3B649D943A038C9B7.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

F405603E2A724FD7BDEB26B07D59D404.description: Determine the central idea of a passage; details or facts related to it.

E9779FBB29544B1E9FA96C61644B0EB5.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

CBF6DF973CE8469C84C450CB941F5A97.description: Analyze a text to determine what it says explicitly as well as what inferences should be drawn.

4DCE0F5DA9704675850007644B68B9AF.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

D5AEF21AF922426A932EE5AC87D4E443.description: Actively engage in reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text for sustained periods of time."

0B10593AB6D64F98997ACCE5FB446CAC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

F2C5B427C84447E6AC402852219D360B.description: Compare texts with similar topics or themes.

A47EEB9041794ACCB4E1D402593E04E8.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

3320520F555B4BA9A201B2CF6666A292.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

FDDD1DBC4F094B048294EA75F25E80B3.description:
Compare the experience of reading or listening to a written story, drama or poem with the experience of watching video or live performance of
the same text.

8844904DCE3B469E86D76398FB82F212.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

9CA7FD1F21C545DE87E847AB08E5F58F.description: Identify words or phrases in the text that describe what the narrator or speaker is thinking or feeling.

63E0F36A50854C81B7484135EB381FCD.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

35DED3B8C3014FE98FB08D202930B5B1.description: Determine the structure of a text.

E693D680DAB44D1294D60BC1E5855DAC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

E6E8F49A2A774D6D904FCDA251C6CF4E.description: Determine how different words could change the meaning of a text.

A248752DA30248859D6DB8848D87AFED.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

13AF71CC750C430CA51DEA6911DB1114.description: Identify how a character responds to a challenge in a story.

03301C82936742D59584B13390657F14.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

7852781E31194EE08A73BD9D7D4F1579.description: Identify details in a text that are related to the theme.

35330D6608A04A6580F4AAD50AD6F965.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

CF96797AA96240EC913F986D24E064B7.description: Determine what a text says explicitly as well as what simple inferences must be drawn.

6AC6F49924B74FAA8809065954A48E69.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
